content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why Protestant reformers sometimes came into conflict with Protestant rulers of the states in which they lived?

choices.label: Some reformers were concerned that secular rulers were overly confrontational when dealing with the papacy.
Some reformers believed that the church should not be subject to the secular state.
Most reformers wished to create a universal church that would replace secular governments entirely.
Most reformers sought to reduce or eliminate sacraments, rituals, and other religious practices they regarded as superstitious.
